text: Shuttlecock Regulations
label: n

text: Most people play badminton with a natural shuttlecock. But you can also get feathered shuttles or the synthetic type. You will need a collection of shuttlecocks that meet the regulations.
label: n

text: Modern badminton equipment has improved a lot since it originated as ' Battledore and Shuttlecock '. That occurred in Greece around 2,000 years ago.
label: n

text: Nowadays, shuttles get graded according to their speed. Experts say the best feathered examples get made from the left wing of a goose.
label: n

text: The Badminton World Federation is the governing body. They oversee the laws and specifications on equipment of badminton and its definition. Their equipment regulations govern championships and tournament competitions.
label: n

text: The BWF governance also relates to the shuttlecocks used in the game. Shuttles must meet certain criteria and stipulations. Nonetheless, a variation of up to 10% gets accepted for non-feathered shuttles.
label: n

text: Feathered Shuttlecock Regulations
label: n

text: The shuttle should have 16 feathers fixed in a cork base and covered in kid leather.
label: n

text: The feathers must have a uniform length between 62 to 70mm when measured from the tip to the top of the base.
label: n

text: the feathers should lie on a circle with a diameter from 58 to 68mm.
label: n

text: The feathers must get fastened firmly with thread or other suitable material.
label: n

text: The base must be 25 to 28mm in diameter and rounded on the bottom.
label: n

text: The shuttle should weigh between 4.74 and 5.50 grams.

text: As a rule, a shuttle flies faster when the weather is hot and it will travel slower when the air temperature is cold.

text: Badminton Racket Sizes and Materials
label: n

text: The BWF regulates the official codified laws of badminton game. They also relate to the size and integrity of rackets used by the players.
label: n

text: The racket stringed section should not exceed 27.94 cm in length or 20.9 cm in width.
label: n

text: The overall length should not exceed 68 cm or 23 cm in width .
label: n

text: Badminton rackets regulations do not allow them to exceed 22.86 cm in width at the widest point.
label: n

text: Badminton racket frames were traditionally made from wood in the early days.
label: n

text: Nowadays manufacturers use a wide range and combination of composite materials. They include steel, graphite carbon fiber, titanium, aluminium alloy, ceramic, and boron.
label: n

text: These composite materials produce lightweight and sturdy frames. In most cases, the best badminton rackets weigh less than 100 grams.

text: Badminton Court Shoes
label: y

text: The best pair of badminton shoes provide good grip or traction on court. No doubt you will be aiming to have good badminton footwork skills. Thus, you need cushioning, support, and some flexibility around the forefoot area.
label: n

text: There is a serious point to this. You should never wear jogging shoes to play badminton. Jogging shoes have thicker soles and lack stability on the court surface. This can increase the likelihood of twisting your ankle.
label: n

text: Experts have a rule of thumb to size a shoe for proper fit. Leave a space about one thumb's width from the tip of your big toe to the tip of the shoes.
label: n

text: Even when you wear sports socks, this still allows a little space for your feet to move inside your shoes.
label: n

text: Heel cups may be a good investment to help protect your heels too. They can also extend the lifespan of your badminton shoes.

text: Equipment
label: n

text: Badminton clothing should be comfortable. That means loose, so it does not hinder your movements. A cotton round-neck or t-shirt with a pair of light shorts will be ideal.
label: n

text: Similar clothing for badminton officials is also recommended. The cardiovascular activity in badminton means your body will produce a lot of sweat.
label: n

text: Wearing a normal cotton t-shirt will help to absorb your sweat. But, a trendy or fancy shirt may perform even better. Bring a track suit along too so you can warm up before you start to play and make a gradual cool down after the game.
label: n

text: Badminton Net
label: y

text: The Badminton World Federation enforces the rules for the net. They include the height, width, and construction of the net used in match games.
label: n

text: Official badminton nets must measure 5 feet from the ground to the highest point in the center. The net must measure a maximum height of 5 feet 1 inch at the sides.
label: n

text: The net attaches to a vertical post positioned on either side of the court. The net itself should be 30 inches from the top down to the bottom edge.
label: n

text: The mesh material must be uniform and dark in color with white tape running along the top edge. The tape makes the full height visible to all players and the match officials.
